music

Class Fraction

  • java.lang.Object
    • music.Fraction

  • public final class Fraction
extends java.lang.Object
    The Fraction class is a mathematical fraction with a numerator and denominator. It is used throughout abcplayer to represent durations in terms of musical length. Fraction objects are immutable.

      • Fraction

        public Fraction(int numerator,
        int denominator)
        Instantiates a new fraction and automatically simplifies it.
        Parameters:
        numerator - the numerator of this fraction. Must be nonnegative.
        denominator - the denominator of this fraction. Must be positive.

      • multiply

        public Fraction multiply(int numerator,
                int denominator)
        Multiply this fraction with the numerator and denominator of another fraction. Only used for tuplets, so preconditions are that numerator and denominator must be between 1 and 10.
        Parameters:
        numerator - the numerator of the other fraction
        denominator - the denominator of the other fraction
        Returns:
        a new Fraction object representing the fraction resulting from the multiplication

        Overrides:

        Returns:
        a string representation (purely for debugging purposes)
        See Also:
        Object.toString()
